questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a chamber of the heart?
questions.answer: Pulmonary chamber

questions.question: What is the function of the sinoatrial (SA) node?
choices: To pump blood out of the heart
To act as the heart's natural pacemaker
To separate the atria from the ventricles
To prevent backflow of blood in veins
questions.answer: To act as the heart's natural pacemaker

questions.question: Which blood vessels have the thinnest walls?
questions.answer: Capillaries

questions.question: What is the primary function of alveoli in the lungs?
choices: To filter air entering the lungs
To warm and humidify inhaled air
questions.answer: To facilitate gas exchange

questions.question: During which phase of the cardiac cycle do the ventricles contract?
questions.answer: Ventricular systole

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a component of the respiratory system?
questions.answer: Nephrons

questions.question: What is the main function of the pulmonary circulation?
choices: To deliver oxygenated blood to body tissues
To remove carbon dioxide from the blood
To filter blood through the kidneys
questions.answer: To remove carbon dioxide from the blood

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the process of inhalation?
choices: Intercostal muscles relax, ribs move downward
Air is forcefully pushed out of the lungs
questions.answer: Diaphragm contracts, lung volume increases

questions.question: What is the primary function of hemoglobin in red blood cells?
questions.answer: To transport oxygen

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of veins?
questions.answer: Have valves to prevent backflow

questions.question: What is the tidal volume?
choices: The maximum amount of air that can be exhaled after maximum inhalation
The amount of air remaining in the lungs after maximum exhalation
The amount of air moved into or out of the lungs during normal breathing
The total lung capacity minus the residual volume
questions.answer: The amount of air moved into or out of the lungs during normal breathing

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a function of the cardiovascular system?
questions.answer: Production of digestive enzymes

questions.question: What is the correct sequence of blood flow through the heart?
choices: Right atrium → right ventricle → lungs → left atrium → left ventricle
Left atrium → left ventricle → lungs → right atrium → right ventricle
Right ventricle → right atrium → lungs → left ventricle → left atrium
Left ventricle → left atrium → lungs → right ventricle → right atrium
questions.answer: Right atrium → right ventricle → lungs → left atrium → left ventricle

questions.question: Which of the following is a function of the respiratory system?
choices: Filtering blood to remove waste products
Facilitating gas exchange between air and blood
questions.answer: Facilitating gas exchange between air and blood

questions.question: What is the primary driving force for gas exchange in the alveoli?
questions.answer: Concentration gradients

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a component of the cardiac conduction system?
questions.answer: Hepatic portal vein

questions.question: What is the function of the mitral valve in the heart?
choices: To prevent backflow from the right ventricle to the right atrium
To prevent backflow from the left ventricle to the left atrium
To regulate blood flow into the pulmonary artery
To control blood flow into the aorta
questions.answer: To prevent backflow from the left ventricle to the left atrium

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of arteries?
choices: Thick, elastic walls to withstand high pressure
questions.answer: Thick, elastic walls to withstand high pressure

questions.question: What is the primary function of the diaphragm in respiration?
choices: To warm and humidify inhaled air
To change the volume of the thoracic cavity
To filter air entering the lungs
questions.answer: To change the volume of the thoracic cavity

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a vital sign typically measured to assess cardiovascular and respiratory function?
questions.answer: Bone density

questions.question: What is the main function of the pulmonary artery?
choices: To carry oxygenated blood from the lungs to the heart
To carry deoxygenated blood from the heart to the lungs
To distribute oxygenated blood to body tissues
To return deoxygenated blood from body tissues to the heart
questions.answer: To carry deoxygenated blood from the heart to the lungs

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the process of external respiration?
choices: The exchange of gases between alveoli and capillaries
The exchange of gases between capillaries and body tissues
The process of inhalation and exhalation
The production of ATP in mitochondria
questions.answer: The exchange of gases between alveoli and capillaries

questions.question: What is the function of the aortic valve?
choices: To prevent backflow from the aorta into the left ventricle
To regulate blood flow between the right atrium and right ventricle
To control blood flow into the pulmonary artery
To separate the left and right sides of the heart
questions.answer: To prevent backflow from the aorta into the left ventricle

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of the alveolar-capillary membrane?
choices: Extremely thin to allow rapid diffusion
Actively pumps gases across the membrane
questions.answer: Extremely thin to allow rapid diffusion

questions.question: What is the primary function of red blood cells?
questions.answer: To transport oxygen

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a factor that affects the rate of diffusion in the alveoli?
choices: Surface area of the alveolar-capillary membrane
questions.answer: Blood type of the individual

questions.question: What is the primary function of the coronary arteries?
choices: To remove deoxygenated blood from the heart
To supply oxygenated blood to the heart muscle
To regulate blood pressure in the aorta
To filter blood before it enters the heart
questions.answer: To supply oxygenated blood to the heart muscle

questions.question: Which of the following is a normal adult resting respiratory rate?
questions.answer: 12-20 breaths per minute

questions.question: What is the primary function of the bundle of His in the heart?
choices: To delay electrical impulses between atria and ventricles
To rapidly conduct impulses through the ventricles
To prevent backflow of blood in the heart
questions.answer: To rapidly conduct impulses through the ventricles

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a normal physiological response to exercise?
choices: Decreased blood flow to active muscles
questions.answer: Decreased blood flow to active muscles
